titles.title: Tax Relief Guarantee Act

To amend the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to establish a point of order that precludes raising revenues to enforce the bipartisan budget agreement if there is a revenue shortfall in any of fiscal years 1998 through 2002.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on the Budget, and in addition to the Committee on Rules, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.summary: 7/23/1997--Introduced. Tax Relief Guarantee Act - Amends the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to provide a point of order in the House of Representatives or the Senate against the consideration of legislation to raise revenues to meet a revenue shortfall for any of FY 1998 through 2002 in order to achieve a balanced Federal budget by FY 2002.
